name: scheuchzeria-palustris
fruit-description: Three parted capsules with two seeds each green maturing to yellow 1/4" long.   Seeds are elliptic, and dark brown 4 mm long.
flower-description: 1/4" wide 3 to 6 stalked flowers with six tepals each on a raceme alternately arranged on a stem.   Flowers are purple brown to creamy white in color.
leaf-description: Grass-like leaves smooth margins, no hairs, stalkless and an open hole at the end.  Lower leaves can reach a length of 16" and width of 1/8" but get smaller as they ascend the stems. Leaf bases sheath the stem and have a membrane where it meets the blade
